summary: The Affordable Care Act federal health insurance exchange allows people to enroll outside of the annual open enrollment period under certain circumstances, such as losing coverage from an employer. Insurers are concerned that some people are misusing this flexibility by reenrolling after their coverage was terminated for nonpayment of premiums. Not only is this against the rules, but it undermines the stability of the exchange...
title: Federal Health Insurance Exchange: CMS Needs to Ensure Complete Accurate Data on Terminations of Coverage for Nonpayment of Premiums
